channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for LA

item.title: Report E-2024100266
item.description:
Report E-2024100266

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-10T09:22:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-19
  • City: Port Allen
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: OCCIDENTAL CHEMICAL CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 9/19/24 at 2:45am, shortly after refueling at Loves Truck Stop in Port Allen, LA, an OxyChem truck driver noticed liquid coming from the drain tube for the trailerâ€™s dome. The driver immediately pulled to the side of the road to inspect the trailer. Upon inspection, three of the dome lugs were less than tool tight. The driver immediately notified OxyChem dispatch and OxyChem management. A third-party technician responded and tightened the lugs. The driver performed a slosh test and discovered the dome was still not sealed. The OxyChem Response Team responded and temporarily secured the dome to prevent leakage during movement to a nearby truck repair facility. The OxyChem Response team then replaced the dome gasket, which resolved the issue. The LA State Police Hazmat was notified. There are no injuries, exposures, damage, or environmental impact.

item.title: Report X-2024091109
item.description:
Report X-2024091109

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-10T09:22:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-14
  • City: LIVONIA
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 2
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 875
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: An odor was reported in the Livonia train yard by car department personnel. Haz Mat Manager Tom Robinson was called for a response. Manager Robinson found that the A end liquid valve was not closed, and the plug was less than tool tight. Mgr. Robinson closed the valve and secured the plug properly. UPRR is requesting the shipper to get an OTMA for the car to continue in transportation.
